parse.title: List of cultural entities with sole naming rights

text.*:
This is a dynamic list and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by expanding it with reliably sourced entries.
The examples and perspective in this article deal primarily with North America and do not represent a worldwide view of the subject. You may improve this article, discuss the issue on the talk page, or create a new article, as appropriate. (December 2010) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

The following is a list of cultural entities with sole naming rights:

Contents

  • 1 Awards
    • 1.1 Art awards
    • 1.2 Literary awards
    • 1.3 Music awards
    • 1.4 Scientific awards
    • 1.5 Sporting awards
  • 2 Museums
    • 2.1 Canada
  • 3 Performing arts venues
    • 3.1 Argentina
    • 3.2 Canada
    • 3.3 Chile
    • 3.4 Japan
    • 3.5 Mexico
    • 3.6 Philippines
    • 3.7 South Korea
    • 3.8 United States
  • 4 Sports
  • 5 References
  • 6 See also

Awards[edit]

Art awards[edit]

  • BP Portrait Award, BP [1] [2]

Literary awards[edit]

  • Rogers Writers' Trust Fiction Prize, Rogers Communications. Formerly the Writers' Trust Fiction Prize. [3]
  • Scotiabank Giller Prize, Bank of Nova Scotia. Formerly the Giller Prize. [4][5][6]

Music awards[edit]

  • High1 Seoul Music Awards, Kangwon Land. [7][8]
  • UnionPay Artist of the Year (Mnet Asian Music Awards), China UnionPay. [9]

Scientific awards[edit]

  • Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel, Swedish National Bank. [10]

Sporting awards[edit]

  • Bud Light Plus-Minus Award, Anheuser-Busch.

(Snapple brand)

Wells Fargo Pavilion Sacramento, California Wells Fargo

References[edit]

  1. ^ "BP Portrait Award 2017". www.npg.org.uk. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  2. ^ "Painting of nursing mother wins BP Portrait Award 2017". The Guardian. 20 June 2017. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  3. ^ "Rogers Writers' Trust Fiction Prize". Historica Canada. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  4. ^ St. John’s, NL. "The Scotiabank Giller Prize Presents Its 2017 Longlist". SCOTIABANK. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  5. ^ "The Scotiabank Giller Prize Presents its 2017 Longlist". Business insider. 18 September 2017. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  6. ^ Marketwired (16 January 2017). "Introducing the 2017 Scotiabank Giller Prize Jury". wallstreet-online.de. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  7. ^ J. K (19 January 2017). "Winners Of The 26th Seoul Music Awards". soompi. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  8. ^ "EXO sets Seoul Music Awards record". yonhapnews. 15 January 2016. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  9. ^ "UnionPay International Exclusively Sponsors 2015 Mnet Asian Music Awards-Cardholders can buy tickets in advance via "UnionPay Online Payment"". asianetnews. Retrieved 24 September 2017. 
  10. ^ "The Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel 2016". nobelprize.org. Retrieved 24 September 2017.
